name: 3-amino-1-(4-chlorophenyl)-1h-pyrazole
Reason: 3-Amino-1-(4-chlorophenyl)-1H-pyrazole has a melting point influenced by functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The basic unit we can compare to is 1-phenylhydrazine, which has a melting point of around 30 degrees Celsius. The additional functional groups and structural features in 3-amino-1-(4-chlorophenyl)-1H-pyrazole will affect its melting point: (1) The chlorine atom introduces a significant withdrawing group, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +50 degrees Celsius. (2) The phenyl group introduces additional rigidity and pi-pi interactions, estimated at around +20 degrees Celsius. (3) The amino group introduces additional rigidity and hydrogen bonding potential, estimated at around +10 degrees Celsius. The effects are additive.
